metadata.dc:title: Myopia and retinal striae induced by topiramate
metadata.dc:description: Clinical case: A 23-year-old woman who was seen due to decreasing far visual acuity 24 hoursafter starting treatment with topiramate. In the cycloplegic refraction, RE showed -4.25 andLE -4.50. Retinal striae could be seen in the macula of both eyes. The alterations ceased48 hours after the drug treatment was interrupted.Discussion: Drug induced acutemyopia is an infrequent phenomenon, the aetiology of whichis still not fully known(AU)
